alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued April 04 at 1:22PM MDT until April 05 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the first High Wind Watch, northwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. For the second High Wind Watch, northwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...In Kansas, Cheyenne County. In Colorado, Yuma County. In Nebraska, Dundy County. * WHEN...For the first High Wind Watch, from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. For the second High Wind Watch, from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing dust will impact area travel lowering visibility to one mile or less at times.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
